Articles.Content:
I would love to see this incorporated with a module manager patch...

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/57603-0-23-RasterPropMonitor-make-your-IVA-a-glass-cockpit-(v0-12)-25-Dec

EDIT: NEVERMIND

It already is! Sam Hall , update your first post buddy!

Edited December 31, 2013 by UAL002

How to switch IVA in mk2 cockpit? I mean, to look back, at kerbal face in IVA. I can't find it anywhere.

Some1 in this thread told, that with "shift" in numeric pad... Well.. I don't have any. I tried also every combinations with shift/alt/ctrl + numeric pad.

How to switch IVA in mk2 cockpit? I mean, to look back, at kerbal face in IVA. I can't find it anywhere.

Some1 in this thread told, that with "shift" in numeric pad... Well.. I don't have any. I tried also every combinations with shift/alt/ctrl + numeric pad.

I believe that to be the numeric keypd in the IVA, not on your keyboard. Click the shift key!
Thanks!
sry if someone already talk about it, but a RPM compatibility would be awesome now ! anyway thx for the mod

sry if someone already talk about it, but a RPM compatibility would be awesome now ! anyway thx for the mod

Don't want to sound rude but if you would bother with reading the OP from RPM you would see that the Mk2 prop placement was recently changed and it actually is included in RPM directly for a while now....

Quoted from the changelog in the RPM OP

Sam Hall's Mk2 cockpit got the full prop replacement treatment. If it is installed as distributed, the patch will be automatically used, otherwise you will get the usual Generic Space with props.

And even the old MM patch made by therealcrow999 is posted exactly one page previous to this one..... ..
Very nice adds very little to the game, but in a big way.

This mod is bugged in 23.5 (ARM Patch). When launching a spaceplane from the runway there will be no Kerbal cockpit view on the bottom right, IVA isn't available, and there is no staging column. I could still right click on the engine and start it that way.

I reinstalled the stock part.cfg file, and everything worked fine again. Hopefully SH is still on the forums, maybe he will have a solution

... still works for me.

Linux 64.

Great mod! Although it does look cool, it's not look very realistic:

Overall, my biggest complaint is the thick, curved borders between the windows. It should be more straight with angles, and from outside, the cockpid does not look like there is nearly that much space between the windows; it should be no more than 3 centimeters between each window.

Huh? It looks a *lot* like the F-4's cockpit.

Back in my day we didn't have these new-fangled "hiviz" canopies... </geezer>
Ive finally been able to stand using the mk2 thanks to this mod. It's actually useful as a cockpit now. Thanks

Just installed this with the new glass cockpit version and it works fine.

I may have found a conflict with another mod though.

When I added an external command seat to the outside of the Mk2 cockpit the default internal view was shown.

I was also using TouhouTorpedo's Seat Fixer mod at the time, so I don't know if it is TouhouTorpedo's mod or if the stock seat will do the same?

Sam Hall's profile says he hasn't logged in since February, which is unfortunate.

I'll ask anyway; maybe somebody else will know the answer.

This IVA is superior to the MK1 IVA in almost every way. The one small problem I have is it can be difficult to see over the top of the navball. How hard would it be to raise the camera position a little bit? Is that an easy fix, or a major project?

Sam Hall's profile says he hasn't logged in since February, which is unfortunate.

I'll ask anyway; maybe somebody else will know the answer.

This IVA is superior to the MK1 IVA in almost every way. The one small problem I have is it can be difficult to see over the top of the navball. How hard would it be to raise the camera position a little bit? Is that an easy fix, or a major project?

I think that needs to adjust the model in Unity, do you know you can double click the front round window for a "lean forward" view? Edited May 25, 2014 by Darren9

No I did not know that, thanks!

I just tried it. The problem of staying lined up with the runway while at a high angle of attack is fixed, so that's good... but now I can't see any instruments. LOL
I usually put a RPM camera on the nose of the plane and bring the feed up on one of the screens for landing.

Yeah, I came up with a similar solution by placing a camera on top of the vertical stabilizer.

You can also fly a curved final approach to keep the runway in sight until just before landing. It's a little trickier, but very satisfying when it works right.
I'd love to get this but does it conflict with Rasterpropmoniter?

Where can I get this mod?

The link to kerbal space port redirects to curse.com and I can't find the cockpit there.

Here the Zip file since Spaceport is dead

Dropbox Link

Also it's up on curse now --- > http://www.curse.com/ksp-mods/kerbal/220927-mk2-cockpit-internals

I updated the OP when i moved it there but i guess i also shoulda bumped the thread so people would notice, my bad

Just in case anyone was wondering about possible conflicts, I just downloaded this from Curse, and can confirm that it works fine with 0.23.5 and RPM. The instruments get overwritten properly by the RPM instruments automatically with no adjustments.

EDIT (Internals not showing up)

Guh, disregard. I mis-installed my mods. A fresh install of KSP and all mods made everything better.

Edited June 8, 2014 by NoClass
Really like this mod, (makes flying in IVA look good ), but the curse download just gives me error 404. Any help?
